intro: Salmonea, commonly known as the salmonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking, salmon-pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Salmonea thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
